page.title: 11GEOGRAPHY OF KINNEFF AREA
page.content: In the{Kinneff area}there are 9 farms. The crops are mainly grass ,wheat ,barley and potatoes. In one field there is flax. One of the farmers has been subsidised to grow flax as an experiment. If the flax is a success, they will grow a larger quantity next year. At{Todhead}the cliffs are very steep and dangerous.They are inhabited by seabirds such as seagulls , cormorants and wild ducks. Seals can sometimes be seen in the{North Sea. Todhead was named from the name (tod) _a fox. Foxes used to be and still are in this vicinity. Hares,rabbits and other wild creatures can be seen. Near the coast are the ruins and sites of {ancient castles}reminding us of the past. The main coastal road south , carrying heavy traffic ,passes through the village of Kinneff.
